vague_description: Decide on the best mix of two types of transportation to efficiently move a group of people within certain constraints.
detailed_description: A golf course is hosting an event and can transport guests using either golf carts or pull carts. A golf cart can take \param{GolfCartCapacity} guests while a pull cart can take \param{PullCartCapacity} guest. Since golf carts take up a lot of space, at most \param{MaxGolfCartProportion} of carts can be golf carts. If the golf course needs to transport at least \param{MinGuests} guests, how many of each cart should be used to minimize the total number of carts needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of carts needed to transport guests
target_constraints: Number of golf carts is non-negative
Number of pull carts is non-negative
At most MaxGolfCartProportion of the total number of carts can be golf carts
At least MinGuests guests need to be transported
target_parameters: Number of guests that a golf cart can take
Number of guests that a pull cart can take
Maximum proportion of carts that can be golf carts
Minimum number of guests the golf course needs to transport
